points: Oversaw the research and implementation of an urgent feature for MS Teams, where fullscreen toggle on video chat messages must be disabled on unsupported versions of Teams desktop (ver. >1.4.7) and other scenarios (popout chat, Teams Outlook extension) for the MVP product of MS Teams inline video chat
Used Azure DevOps to organize and track PBIs required to complete the feature, organizing the requirements and acceptance criteria, as well as the work effort and priority of each PBI task

Exposed a new parameter for manually disabling fullscreen toggle in the OnePlayer React codebase, allowing the parameter to be consumed on the MS Teams codebase when initializing video chat messages via OnePlayer API, the parameter value is set using a combination of configuration setting flags to determine fullscreen support eligibility
Maintained 100% code compatibility on OnePlayer and MS Teams codebases by writing unit tests in JEST and ensuring all PR build pipelines on Azure DevOps pass

Led a team of 4 developers to transform an existing prototype into a production-grade web application in the span of 4 months, meant as a promotional platform to support Scarborough restaurants during this pandemic

Coded over 2000+ lines of Python and 500+ lines of Typescript to the overall codebase. Was named the 'expert of all things' and developer team lead, contributing the most in terms of backend CRUD APIs, Django admin functionalities, Angular frontend page layouts, and the deployment pipeline
Implemented, tested, and deployed a temporary data collection page within tight timeline constraints, had to learn the basics of Nginx and Docker in 2 days

Assisted in improving the project's foundational security, and migrated 10+ features over to the new codebase in less than 2 weeks; concurrently improved the implementation and documentation of several functions

Crucially designed and engineered overall layout for the Django backend, ensuring consistency of error-handling and MongoDB operations between 7 CRUD API apps, as well as simplifying how errors are displayed on the user end

Immediately picked up the basics of SoapUI and the RBC mortgage & credit form fill-in system within the 1st week of onboarding; was able to begin making test cases by the end of the week and smoothly transitioned to the next project about 2 weeks later
Adapted to heavier workloads and tighter deadlines immediately on the day remote work-from-home began
Wrote test cases and automation scripts in LeanFT C# on the 1st week of being onboarded to the mortgage/credit API project, reducing the runtime of tests (when done manually) by 70%

Quick to fix and debug any problems in the automation script code, averaging about a half-an-hour of troubleshooting and detailed analysis or less, otherwise will ask project mentor for his expertise on resolving the issue
Collaborated with tech and cross-functional teams to gather requirements and determine tech stacks for developing the health startup’s platform during 2 hour weekly meetings
Acquired the basics of Django within 3 days through online tutorials and with guidance from the CTO, before assisting in the development the company’s backend platform
Researched and compared a number of scheduling software to determine which product and its API is best suited for the company's needs, settled with SimplyBook in the end
Built a Python script which batch-books patients via SimplyBook API and extracts data for EMRs
